page.title: 08ANNAN BY PASS
page.content: A public meeting was held in Annan to discuss plans for a by pass. We carried out a survey to discover what the people of Annan thought about the proposed by pass.Our results show that 86% of those surveyed were in favour of the by pass.The main reason given in favour was to take the heavy traffic off the main street,which is on the A75, and heavily used by traffic going to and from the ferry at Stranraer. Surprisingly 75% of shopkeepers were in favour of the by pass,though many pointed out that they might lose trade. At the public meeting objections were raised by individual members of the public.Mr Younger,the Scottish Secretary,is expected to come to a final decision by the end of the year and work is expected to start in 1986.
